class: center, middle

# Multiple if/else statements

---
# The `happy` data frame

.center[
```{r echo = FALSE}
happy %>% 
  kbl %>% 
  kable_styling()
```
]
---
# `if_else` recap

.center[
```{r echo = FALSE}
happy_if <- happy %>% 
              mutate(in_europe = if_else(country_name == "Spain", TRUE, FALSE))

happy_if %>% 
  kbl %>% 
  kable_styling()
```
]
---
# `if_else` recap

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  mutate(in_europe = if_else(country_name == "Spain", TRUE, FALSE))
```
]
---
# More complex situations

.center[
```{r echo = FALSE}
happy %>% 
  mutate(happy_level = case_when(
    ladder_score < 4.3 ~ "unhappy",
    ladder_score >= 4.3 & ladder_score <= 6 ~ "neutral",
    TRUE ~ "happy"
  ))
```
]
---
# Multiple `if_else()`s

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  mutate(happy_level = if_else(ladder_score < 4.3, "unhappy",
                               if_else(ladder_score >= 4.3 & ladder_score <= 6, "neutral", "happy")))
```
]
--
ugly! 
---
# `case_when()`  

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  mutate(happy_level = case_when(
    ladder_score < 4.3 ~ "unhappy",
    ladder_score >= 4.3 & ladder_score <= 6 ~ "neutral",
    TRUE ~ "happy"
  ))
```
]
